name: df-lshyp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(clsh, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cfv(clss, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wrex(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(clspn, cv(s0)), cun(cv(s1), csn(cv(s2)))), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ LSHyp =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà(LSubSp ` s0)|(s1 ‚â†(Base ` s0)‚àß ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0),((LSpan ` s0)`(s1 ‚ãÉ { s2 }))=(Base ` s0)))})
comment: Define the set of all hyperplanes of a left module or left vector space. Also called co-atoms, these are subspaces that are one dimension less that the full space. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jun-2014.)
